event: Comienza a utilizarse el "optimal control" (OC)
Aparece "Dynamic Programming" (DP)
reference: Bellman, R. E. (1957a). Dynamic Programming. Princeton University Press,Princeton.

event: Introducen los Markov Decision Processes (MDP)
reference: Bellman, R. E. (1957b). A Markov decision process. Journal of Mathematical Mechanics, 6:679–684

event: Aparece el metodo de iteracion de politicas
reference: Howard, R. (1960). Dynamic Programming and Markov Processes. MIT Press, Cambridge, MA.

event: Se desarrolla extensamente la DP
Werbos conecta el OC y PD
reference:
Werbos, P. J. (1977). Advanced forecasting methods for global crisis warning
and models of intelligence. General Systems Yearbook, 22:25–38.

event: Watkins integra los metodos de aprendizaje (MA)
reference: Watkins, C. J. C. H. (1989). Learning from Delayed Rewards. Ph.D. thesis, Cambridge University.

event: Aparece el termino "Neurodynamic Programming"
reference: "Bertsekas
column6: J. N. (1989). Parallel and Distributed Computation: Numerical Methods. Prentice-Hall

event: Primer idea del "trial-and-error learning" (TaEL)
reference: Thorndike, E. L. (1911). Animal Intelligence. Hafner, Darien, CT.

event: Aparece el termino "Reinforcement" en el contexto del aprendizaje animal
reference: Pavlov, P. I. (1927). Conditioned Reflexes. Oxford University Press, London.

event: Turing describe un diseno para un sistema "pleasure-pain system"
reference: Turing, A. M. (1948). Intelligent Machinery, A Heretical Theory. The Turing Test: Verbal Behavior as the Hallmark of Intelligence, 105.

event: Minsky Farley y Clark publican sus investigaciones sobre TaEL.
reference: Farley, B. G., Clark, W. A. (1954). Simulation of self-organizing systems by digital computer. IRE Transactions on Information Theory, 4:76–84.

event: Se utilizan por primera vez en ingeniería"Reinforcement" y "Reinforcement Learning"
reference: Mendel, J. M. (1966). A survey of learning control systems. ISA Transactions,5:297–303

event: Se publica "Steps Toward Artificial Intelligence"
reference: Minsky, M. L. (1961). Steps toward artificial intelligence. Proceedings of the Institute of Radio Engineers, 49:8–30. Reprinted in E. A. Feigenbaum and J. Feldman (eds.), Computers and Thought, pp. 406–450. McGraw-Hill, New York, 1963.

event: Se desarrolla STeLLA
reference: "Andreae
column4: J. H. (1963). STELLA: A scheme for a learning machine. In Proceedings of the 2nd IFAC Congress

event: Se describe un sistema "TaEL" para el tic-tac-toe
reference: "Michie
column4: D. (1963). Experiments on the mechanisation of game learning. 1. characterization of the model and its parameters. Computer Journal

event: Widrow, Gupta y Maitra modifican el LMS.
reference: Widrow, B., Gupta, N. K., Maitra, S. (1973). Punish/reward: Learning with a critic in adaptive threshold systems. IEEE Transactions on Systems,Man, and Cybernetics, 3:455–465.

event: Se originan los "Learning Automata"
reference: Tsetlin, M. L. (1973). Automaton Theory and Modeling of Biological Systems. Academic Press, New York.

event: Teoría del aprendizaje de Bush y Mostelle
reference: "Bush
column6: F. (1955). Stochastic Models for Learning. Wiley

event: "Reinforcement Learning" en economia
reference: Camerer, C. (2003). Behavioral game theory: Experiments in strategic interaction. Princeton University Press.

event: Vision general del Reinforcement Learning y Juegos
reference: Now´e, A., Vrancx, P., De Hauwere, Y. M. (2012). Game theory and multiagent reinforcement learning. In Reinforcement Learning (pp. 441-470).Springer Berlin Heidelberg.

event: Introducen los clasificadores
reference: "Holland
column4: J. H. (1986). Escaping brittleness: The possibility of general-purpose learning algorithms applied to rule-based systems. In R. S. Michalski
column7: Machine Learning: An Artificial Intelligence Approach

event: Trabajo de Klopf
reference: "Klopf
column4: A. H. (1972). Brain function and adaptive systems—A heterostatic theory. Technical Report AFCRL-72-0164
column7: MA. A summary appears in Proceedings of the International Conference on Systems

event: Sutton desarrolla las ideas de Klopf
reference:
Sutton, R. S. (1978a). Learning theory support for a single channel theory of
the brain. Unpublished report.
